body_html:
Also happens on Mac: #46
Also reported on stackexchange: http://stackoverflow.com/questions/33623453/pip-installation-error-no-such-file-or-directory-setup-py where they claim that "with python 2.7.10, python-dev and pip 1.5.6, tensorflow will be successfully installed using the pip method."

But, as seen below, updating pip did not work for spiderhacker, so I am striking out the rest of this comment. -2015 Nov 13 23:45 UTC

What version of pip are you using (type "pip --version")
If you see a version less than 1.5.6, type "pip install --upgrade pip" within your virtualenv to get it to update itself.
I did this in my system and it worked (but I'm on Mac, so you still need to try it and comment here to tell if it worked)

But, as seen below, updating pip did not work for spiderhacker, so I am striking out the rest of this comment. -2015 Nov 13 23:45 UTC
What version of pip are you using (type "pip --version")
If you see a version less than 1.5.6, type "pip install --upgrade pip" within your virtualenv to get it to update itself.
I did this in my system and it worked (but I'm on Mac, so you still need to try it and comment here to tell if it worked)
body:
Also happens on Mac: https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/issues/46
 Also reported on stackexchange: http://stackoverflow.com/questions/33623453/pip-installation-error-no-such-file-or-directory-setup-py where they claim that "with python 2.7.10, python-dev and pip 1.5.6, tensorflow will be successfully installed using the pip method."

But, as seen below, updating pip did _not_ work for **spiderhacker**, so I am striking out the rest of this comment. -2015 Nov 13 23:45 UTC

~~What version of pip are you using (type "pip --version")~~
~~If you see a version less than 1.5.6, type "pip install --upgrade pip" within your virtualenv to get it to update itself.~~
~~I did this in my system and it worked (but I'm on Mac, so you still need to try it and comment here to tell if it worked)~~
